intro: Boehmeria densiflora var. boninensis, commonly known as the Bonin Boehmeria, is a flowering plant native to the Bonin Islands. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettle plants, and is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically wind-pollinated. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
